description: Primary duty position as the CHAMS Engineering Support Team Manager. Responsible for supervising the Engineering Support Team functions to include: Property Accountability, Quality Assurance (QA), Configuration Management (CM), Test, Documentation, Training, Computer-Based Training, Automated Testing with WinRunner, Security, Automation Infrastructure, and Process Improvement in compliance with SEI/CMMI guidelines. Directs the testing of all SPRs and baseline issues for patches and software deliveries prior to release to the field. Writes and reviews test plans and reports for applicability and accuracy. Ensures interim software builds for baseline releases are functional and provides copies to Test, Training and Documentation personnel. Assist developers in testing and documentation of communications protocols. Key member of the Configuration Control Board (CCB) Working Group to adjudicate SPRs prior to CCB vote. Acts as the technical expert to external system users, including the members of the user help-desk staff. Responsible for providing monthly automated metrics results to the Project Manager for inclusion into the Program Manager Review. Attends requirements analysis reviews, performs quality assurance on all requirements documents prior to delivery. Produces the Requirements Traceability Matrix (RTM) for tracing requirements from User Function Description Document through all requirements documentation to the implementation test case. Responsible for all Deliverable Documentation QA to outside agencies. Directs the production of CBT Modules and ensures technical accuracy of CBT, documentation, and training products. Responsible for reporting to the respective Government Agency all property held on-site and audits of that property.

name: Paul Knoblock
description: Key Responsibilities - Global helpdesk assistance 15,000+ customers. - Incoming calls, responding to logged incidents and requests. - Diagnose and rectify hardware and software problems via local and remote access. - IBM Lotus Notes, SAP and Microsoft Office. Troubleshooting and resolutions. - Investigating network connectivity problems and if required escalating to fellow team members. - Identifying vulnerabilities in third party software and logging requests with vendors. - Analysing, troubleshooting and researching inefficient patches and low compliance workstations. - Adhering to patch compliance norms and organisational KPIs. - Creating reports and representing team in meetings. - Training customers in organisational procedures, policies and service order management software. - Building workstations with custom software, specific to the organisations security policy. - Logging and tracking incidents and requests through service management software. - Creating and approving internal and external knowledge articles. - Software filter management (install/uninstall) via Symantec Management Console. - Adhering to strict organisational policies. Key Achievements - Resolved over 2500 incidents and 1000 requests with an average call time of six minutes. - Improved service management call logging efficiency by the implementation of short description templates. This demonstrated strong interpersonal skills by deriving the ideas and experiences of the entire team through group brainstorming and adhering to organisational change management policies. - Demonstrated a strong ability to improve organisational security patch compliance by increasing Orica’s global patch full compliancy by 7.2% in first month.

title: IT Consultant
name: Paul Knoblock
description: Key Responsibilities - Working with clients to determine requirements and scope of work. - Clarifying a client’s system specification, understanding the nature of their business. - Defining software, hardware and network requirements. - Presenting solutions in written and oral reports. - Developing agreed solutions and implementing new systems. - Purchasing systems where appropriate. - Advising clients how to use information technology in order to meet their business objectives. - Designing, testing, installing and monitoring new systems. - Preparing and presenting progress reports to customers. - Organising and instructing training sessions for users. - Identifying potential clients, building and maintaining existing contacts. Key Achievements - Established a large interstate customer base with a trusted reputation to deliver a reliable IT service. - Brought efficient IT infrastructure to small business through managed IT services. - Demonstrated strong time management and project management skills by successfully relocating multiple companies with minimal downtime. These projects require scope of work documentation, delegating sub-contractors at various phases and completing the projects within deadline. - Ability to document, present and implement all IT request from customers. - Demonstrated creative diversity and a strong understanding of programming language by completing a wide range of websites in a variety of industries.

description: Performs routine work related to transportation activities such as skilled roadway maintenance and repair; light and heavy equipment operation; preventive and minor maintenance on equipment; traffic control; helping the public during emergency situations. Work requires contact with private entities. • Assists in identifying, repairing and installing signs, delineators, mail box supports and posts; performs basic welding as needed; as required uses/moves equipment/tools, materials and products related to these activities.• Assists in providing support to local law enforcement officials at accident sites; assists stranded motorists as required.• Assists with traffic control; places and gathers cones, warning signs and barricades; flags traffic; as required moves items related to these activities that can weigh 50-100 pounds.• Maintains highways and rights-of-way; performs skilled roadway repairs; erects and repairs guard rails, highway markers and signs; hauls materials and equipment to job sites.• Drives a state vehicle and moves/picks up litter and roadway debris to assure a safe thoroughfare; maintains maintenance yards.• Operates light equipment such as a front-end loader, pneumatic roller, rotary broom, spreader box, backhoe, street sweeper and mower.• Performs preventive maintenance inspections (PMI), routine servicing and minor repairs on equipment and completes various required reports including time-keeping, equipment forms, inventory, accident forms and PMI.• Sands or cleans bridges and roads, posts warning signs, helps the public and performs other work as directed during emergency situations such as floods, tornadoes, hurricanes, snowstorms, accidents and hazardous material spills.

description: An innovative oilfield chemical company that provides technologically advanced and environmentally acceptable solutions to the oil and gas production market. Sales Representative Manage relationships with existing production accounts and call directly on new accounts to develop relationships in a highly competitive market. Excel in providing customer service and building long term relationships with existing customers. Test new and existing wells for such problems as excess CO2, H2S, corrosion, or scaling. Perform truck treat, condensate treat, and frac jobs. Have extensive experience with oilfield scale, corrosion, emulsions, paraffins, and gas sweetening. Perform titration testing on water samples to provide accurate water analysis, and grind out oil to determine amount of BS&W and make recommendations. Perform oil /demulsifier bottle testing. Attend oil and gas trade shows to operate a booth and distribute information about our company and visit with existing and potential customers. Repaired and rebuilt Western Chemical Beam Pumps. After training as an assistant in Gruver for two years, have built sales in the 180-square-mile territory from less than $100,000 to more than $350,000 annually. Since taking over the Henrietta territory, have typically added one to two new accounts annually.

title: Cattle & Crop Manager
name: George Essler

groups.name: AGRI JOBS - Agriculture - Agricultural - Farm - Farming - Horti - Hotticultural - Dairy

description: A family-owned farming and ranching business with cattle and crop operations, the firm typically generates annual revenues of $800,000. The organization also operated a small liquid cattle feed distributorship serving mostly local farms. Also, operated a small feedlot/pre-conditioning feedlot storing silage, corn, and hay, mixing feed, feeding, riding pens, processing and doctoring cattle, shipping cattle. Partner / Manager, 2003-2006 Formed a partnership with brother-in-law and leased the farm from a parent. Ensured the productive and profitable operation of the farm by restructuring and giving careful attention to strategic planning and margins. Negotiated contracts for sale of crops and cattle or sold for cash or at auction depending on market conditions. Generated a profit in each year of operation, ultimately selling 50% interest in equipment to partner. Managed purchase, grazing, and sale of 1,200 head of stocker calves annually, negotiating lease agreements for acreage of wheat pasture to graze cattle. Managed inspections and maintenance of a broad range of equipment and ensured compliance with all state and federal regulations including those of the USDA, EPA, and OSHA. Operations Director, 2000-2003 Stepped in to manage a family farm at the time of the owner's serious illness. Supervised the work of up to 10 employees. Consistently maintained the profitability of the operation through careful attention to costs and negotiating contracts for sale of crops.

title: Owner & Cattle Manager

groups.name: AGRI JOBS - Agriculture - Agricultural - Farm - Farming - Horti - Hotticultural - Dairy

description: Created a distributorship of liquid cattle feed serving local farmers as a supplement to their cattle operation. Sourced and purchased products, marketed feed and negotiated pricing. Networked with local farmers to share cattle feed options. Drove sales through 100% positive word-of-mouth and referrals.  Propelled the business from zero to more than $100K in annual revenue within one year. Sold the company for a profit to a customer.
